title: Giya Kancheli, Georgian composer whose sorrowful scores reflected the tragedy and upheavals of his homeland – obituary
text:
Giya Kancheli, who has died aged 84, was a Georgian composer known for his “holy minimalist” style of writing that was infused with nostalgia and melancholy; it often contained an air of sadness and tragedy, something that he attributed to the many upheavals in his homeland.

One of Kancheli’s more unusual works is Little Imber, a piece performed in August 2003 at the abandoned village on Salisbury Plain that for most of the year is used for military training. Over three consecutive nights Imber echoed not to the sound of exploding tank shells or sniper fire, but to Kancheli’s moody score performed by a male-voice choir, a soloist from Salisbury Cathedral and the Matrix Ensemble for 300 people...
